subject: Politics
title: Machiavelli and Realpolitik
description: A fast breakdown of Machiavelli and Realpolitik for builders.

hook.text: Machiavelli said it's better to be feared than loved. 'The Prince' shocked the world by divorcing politics from morals.

buildup.text: Machiavelli argued that effective rulers must sometimes lie, deceive, and use force. Power has its own logic.

discovery.text: 'The Prince' was written in 1513 as practical advice. It described politics as it is, not as it should be.

twist.text: Was Machiavelli evil or honest? Some scholars argue he exposed power's reality to warn citizens, not advise tyrants.

climax.text: Realpolitik â€” power-based pragmatism â€” still defines foreign policy. Morality often takes a backseat to interests.

punchline.text: Machiavelli didn't invent ruthless politics. He just described it honestly.

quiz.question: What was revolutionary about Machiavelli's 'The Prince'?
options: It separated political advice from moral idealism, describing power as it operates
It argued that only moral leaders can succeed
It proposed a democratic system of government
